Countries that use the Nicaraguan córdoba oro

The Nicaraguan córdoba oro was established in 1990 as an official national currency and is used only in Nicaragua. It replaced the previously valid Córdoba Nuevo. 1 Córdoba Oro is devided into 100 Centavos.

Currency reserves for the Nicaraguan córdoba oro

According to the International Monetary Fund, the total broad money (M3) amounted to NIO 220.40 billion at the end of 2022. For currency hedging, reserves were held in a total amount of 158.01 billion córdoba oros. This corresponds to a ratio of 1:1.4. Or in other words, 10 of 14 córdoba oros are deposited with a countervalue, which is internationally already above average.
